generic <typename T> public ref class HashSet : System::Collections::Generic::ICollection<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerable<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IReadOnlyCollection<T>, System::Collections::Generic::ISet<T>, System::Runtime::Serialization::IDeserializationCallback, System::Runtime::Serialization::ISerializable

span.span: Represents a set of values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供高性能的集运算。The class provides high-performance set operations. 一组是一系列，不包含任何重复的元素，且其元素是顺序不分先后。A set is a collection that contains no duplicate elements, and whose elements are in no particular order. > [!NOTE] > 实现开头的接口[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; 在以前版本的.NET Framework 中，类未实现此接口。 implements the interface starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; in previous versions of the .NET Framework, the class did not implement this interface. 容量对象是该对象可以容纳的元素的数目。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the object can hold. A对象的容量会自动增加如元素添加到的对象。A object's capacity automatically increases as elements are added to the object. 类基于数学集的模型，并提供高性能集操作类似于访问的键或集合。The class is based on the model of mathematical sets and provides high-performance set operations similar to accessing the keys of the or collections. 在简单地说，类可以被想象成无需值的集合。In simple terms, the class can be thought of as a collection without values. A集合未排序，并且不能包含重名的元素。A collection is not sorted and cannot contain duplicate elements. 如果你的应用程序的性能比更重要顺序或元素重复，请考虑使用类连同方法。If order or element duplication is more important than performance for your application, consider using the class together with the method. 提供了许多数学设置操作，如集添加 （联合），并设置减法。 provides many mathematical set operations, such as set addition (unions) and set subtraction. 下表列出了所提供操作和及其数学等效项。The following table lists the provided operations and their mathematical equivalents. |HashSet (Of T) 操作HashSet(Of T) operation|数学等效项Mathematical equivalent| |-------------------------------|-----------------------------| ||联合或设置添加Union or set addition| ||交集Intersection| ||集减法Set subtraction| ||对称差异Symmetric difference| 列出的设置操作中，除了类还提供方法来确定集是否相等，重叠集，以及一组是否是的子集或另一个集中的超集。In addition to the listed set operations, the class also provides methods for determining set equality, overlap of sets, and whether a set is a subset or superset of another set. 对于非常大对象，你可以通过设置增加到 20 亿元素在 64 位系统上的最大容量`enabled`到的配置元素的属性`true`在运行时环境中。For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]、类实现接口。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the class implements the interface. ## HashSet 和 LINQ Set 运算HashSet and LINQ Set Operations LINQ 提供了访问`Distinct`， `Union`，`Intersect`和`Except`设置实现的任何数据源上的操作或接口。LINQ provides access to the `Distinct`, `Union`, `Intersect` and `Except` set operations on any data source that implements the or interfaces. 提供一组操作的更大、 更可靠集合。 provides a larger and more robust collection of set operations. 例如，如提供比较和。For example, provides comparisons such as and . 主要区别 LINQ set 运算和操作是 LINQ set 运算始终返回一个新集合，而等效的方法修改当前的集合。The primary difference between LINQ set operations and operations is that LINQ set operations always return a new collection, whereas the equivalent methods modify the current collection. 通常情况下，如果必须创建一个新集或你的应用程序需要访问仅向提供的组操作，使用 LINQ 将操作设置任何集合或数组就够用了。Typically, if you must create a new set or if your application needs access only to the provided set operations, using LINQ set operations on any collection or array will be sufficient. 但是，如果你的应用程序需要访问另一组操作，或不需要或不必要创建新的集合，使用类。However, if your application requires access to additional set operations, or if it is not desirable or necessary to create a new collection, use the class. 下表显示操作和其等效的 LINQ set 运算。The following table shows the operations and their equivalent LINQ set operations. |HashSet (Of T) 操作HashSet(Of T) operation|LINQ 等效项LINQ equivalent| |-------------------------------|---------------------| ||| ||| ||| |未提供。Not provided.|| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何合并两个不同的集。The following example demonstrates how to merge two disparate sets. 此示例创建两个对象，并分别偶数和奇数的数字，来填充它们。This example creates two objects, and populates them with even and odd numbers, respectively. 第三个包含偶数的集从创建对象。A third object is created from the set that contains the even numbers. 该示例然后调用方法，将奇数的数字组添加到第三个组。The example then calls the method, which adds the odd number set to the third set. remarks.format: ## Remarks 容量对象是该对象可以容纳的元素的数目。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the object can hold. A对象的容量会自动增加如元素添加到的对象。A object's capacity automatically increases as elements are added to the object. 如果`collection`包含重复项，则集将包含每个唯一元素之一。If `collection` contains duplicates, the set will contain one of each unique element. 会不引发任何异常。No exception will be thrown. 因此，结果集的大小并不完全相同的大小`collection`。Therefore, the size of the resulting set is not identical to the size of `collection`. 此构造函数是 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是中的元素数`collection`参数。This constructor is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements in the `collection` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何创建从现有集的集合。The following example shows how to create a collection from an existing set. 在此示例中，两个集创建具有偶数和奇数整数分别。In this example, two sets are created with even and odd integers, respectively. 第三个然后偶数集从创建对象。A third object is then created from the even integer set. summary.span: 返回循环访问 对象的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a object.
A object for the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，使用`foreach`建议而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，属性是不确定。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回相同的对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法设置再次为集合的第一个元素必须创建新的枚举器对象相反。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator object instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，则枚举数将失效且不可恢复失效，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 如果调用之间修改集合方法和获取的值属性，返回到，设置的元素，即使枚举数已经无效。If the collection is modified between calling method and obtaining the value of the property, returns the element that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 空集是任何其他集合的真子集。An empty set is a proper subset of any other collection. 因此，此方法返回`true`如果该集合表示由当前对象为空除非`other`参数也是一个空集。Therefore, this method returns `true` if the collection represented by the current object is empty unless the `other` parameter is also an empty set. 此方法始终返回`false`如果大于或等于的中的元素数`other`。This method always returns `false` if is greater than or equal to the number of elements in `other`. 如果该集合由表示`other`是具有的相同的相等比较器，与当前集合对象，则此方法为 O (`n`) 操作。If the collection represented by `other` is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, then this method is an O(`n`) operation. 否则，此方法为 O (`n` + `m`) 操作，其中`n`是和`m`是中的元素数`other`。Otherwise, this method is an O(`n` + `m`) operation, where `n` is and `m` is the number of elements in `other`. ## Examples 下面的示例创建两个不同对象，并将它们彼此进行比较。The following example creates two disparate objects and compares them to each other. 在此示例中，`lowNumbers`是的真子集和子集`allNumbers`直到`allNumbers`使用的修改方法，以包含这两组中存在的值。In this example, `lowNumbers` is both a subset and a proper subset of `allNumbers` until `allNumbers` is modified, using the method, to contain only values that are present in both sets. 一次`allNumbers`和`lowNumbers`是相同的`lowNumbers`仍是的子集`allNumbers`但不再的真子集。Once `allNumbers` and `lowNumbers` are identical, `lowNumbers` is still a subset of `allNumbers` but is no longer a proper subset. span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.

returns.span: 一个可用于循环访问集合的 对象。

span.span: An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，属性是不确定。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回相同的对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法设置再次为集合的第一个元素必须创建新的枚举器对象相反。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator object instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 这一点可能很有用，当你想要重新使用以前存储的引用，而不是一个新构造 （以便更多共享的引用可以发生） 或查找虽然具有更完整的数据比当前具有的值的值时其比较器函数指示它们相等。This can be useful when you want to reuse a previously stored reference instead of a newly constructed one (so that more sharing of references can occur) or to look up a value that has more complete data than the value you currently have, although their comparer functions indicate they are equal.
